content.thinking:
The user has provided detailed instructions about their development style and how they want me to work with them. Let me break down the key points:

1. They're doing mobile development on Android using Termux, with "vibe coding" style (intuitive, rapid prototyping)
2. Their tech stack: Termux + Vim + Git + Claude Code + GitHub, with Vercel for deployment
3. They want me to lead and automate the entire development cycle, from ideation to deployment
4. They want me to be the "driver" while they provide ideas and feedback

I should acknowledge this setup and be ready to help them with whatever they want to build. I'll keep my response concise since they seem to prefer action over long explanations.

Also, I notice they provided extensive documentation about their environment and previous projects, but they haven't asked me to do anything specific yet. I should acknowledge their setup and wait for their first project idea.

content.content:
1â†’# CLAUDE.md
     2â†’
     3â†’This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.
     4â†’
     5â†’## Project Structure
     6â†’
     7â†’This repository contains multiple distinct projects:
     8â†’
     9â†’1. **Whisper.cpp** (`src/whisper.cpp/`) - High-performance C++ implementation of OpenAI's Whisper ASR model
    10â†’2. **DeepDanbooru** (`DeepDanbooru/`) - Python-based anime image tagging system using TensorFlow
    11â†’3. **BeeWare Applications** - Cross-platform Python GUI applications:
    12â†’   - `mybeewareapplication/` - Sample BeeWare application
    13â†’   - `tarot_clip/` - Tarot spread assistant application
    14â†’   - `tarot/` - Another Tarot-related application
    15â†’4. **Simple Applications**:
    16â†’   - `myapp/` - Basic Node.js application
    17â†’
    18â†’## Common Development Commands
    19â†’
    20â†’### Whisper.cpp (C++)
    21â†’```bash
    22â†’# Build the project
    23â†’cd src/whisper.cpp
    24â†’cmake -B build
    25â†’cmake --build build --config Release
    26â†’
    27â†’# Download and test models
    28â†’make base.en  # Downloads base.en model and runs on samples
    29â†’make samples  # Download additional audio samples
    30â†’
    31â†’# Run transcription
    32â†’./build/bin/whisper-cli -f samples/jfk.wav -m models/ggml-base.en.bin
    33â†’
    34â†’# Build with GPU support (CUDA)
    35â†’cmake -B build -DGGML_CUDA=1
    36â†’cmake --build build -j --config Release
    37â†’
    38â†’# Build with other acceleration
    39â†’cmake -B build -DGGML_BLAS=1        # OpenBLAS
    40â†’cmake -B build -DWHISPER_COREML=1   # Core ML (macOS)
    41â†’cmake -B build -DGGML_VULKAN=1      # Vulkan
    42â†’```
    43â†’
    44â†’### DeepDanbooru (Python)
    45â†’```bash
    46â†’cd DeepDanbooru
    47â†’
    48â†’# Install dependencies
    49â†’pip install -r requirements.txt
    50â†’# OR install with TensorFlow
    51â†’pip install .[tensorflow]
    52â†’
    53â†’# Create training project
    54â†’deepdanbooru create-project [project_folder]
    55â†’
    56â†’# Train model
    57â†’deepdanbooru train-project [project_folder]
    58â†’
    59â†’# Evaluate images
    60â†’deepdanbooru evaluate [image_file] --project-path [project_folder]
    61â†’
    62â†’# Run tests
    63â†’pytest  # Based on setup.py test requirements
    64â†’```
    65â†’
    66â†’### BeeWare Applications
    67â†’```bash
    68â†’# For any BeeWare app (tarot_clip, mybeewareapplication, etc.)
    69â†’cd [app_directory]
    70â†’
    71â†’# Install dependencies and run in dev mode
    72â†’briefcase dev
    73â†’
    74â†’# Build for current platform
    75â†’briefcase build
    76â†’
    77â†’# Create distributable package
    78â†’briefcase package
    79â†’
    80â†’# Run tests
    81â†’pytest
    82â†’```
    83â†’
    84â†’### Node.js Application
    85â†’```bash
    86â†’cd myapp
    87â†’
    88â†’# No specific build commands defined
    89â†’# Basic package.json with minimal test script
    90â†’npm test  # Currently just echoes error message
    91â†’```
    92â†’
    93â†’## Architecture Notes
    94â†’
    95â†’### Whisper.cpp
    96â†’- **Core Implementation**: `include/whisper.h` and `src/whisper.cpp`
    97â†’- **GGML Library**: Machine learning operations in `ggml/` directory
    98â†’- **Examples**: Multiple example applications in `examples/` (CLI, server, streaming, etc.)
    99â†’- **Model Formats**: Uses custom GGML binary format for models
   100â†’- **Platform Support**: Cross-platform with optimizations for various hardware (Apple Silicon, CUDA, etc.)
   101â†’
   102â†’### DeepDanbooru
   103â†’- **Model Architecture**: ResNet-based neural network for multi-label classification
   104â†’- **Dataset Structure**: SQLite database with image metadata and hierarchical image storage
   105â†’- **Training Pipeline**: Project-based training system with configurable parameters
   106â†’- **Tag System**: Danbooru-compatible tagging system for anime images
   107â†’
   108â†’### BeeWare Applications
   109â†’- **Framework**: Built on Toga GUI framework for cross-platform deployment
   110â†’- **Targets**: Can build for desktop (macOS, Linux, Windows), mobile (iOS, Android), and web
   111â†’- **Configuration**: Uses `pyproject.toml` with Briefcase tool configuration
   112â†’- **Testing**: pytest-based testing framework
   113â†’
   114â†’## Development Environment
   115â†’
   116â†’This appears to be running in a Termux environment on Android, with development tools installed including:
   117â†’- Android SDK (in `android-sdk/`)
   118â†’- Java toolchain
   119â†’- CMake and build tools
   120â†’- Python with various ML libraries
   121â†’
   122â†’## Important Notes
   123â†’
   124â†’- **Whisper.cpp**: Focus on performance and memory efficiency; supports various acceleration backends
   125â†’- **Model Downloads**: Whisper models are large (75 MiB to 2.9 GiB) and downloaded separately
   126â†’- **Cross-Platform**: BeeWare apps target multiple platforms with platform-specific build requirements
   127â†’- **GPU Acceleration**: Whisper.cpp supports multiple GPU backends (CUDA, Metal, Vulkan, OpenCL)
   128â†’- **Audio Processing**: Whisper expects 16-bit WAV input; use ffmpeg for conversion if needed
   129â†’
   130â†’## 1. ã¯ã˜ã‚ã«ï¼šé–‹ç™ºã®ç†å¿µã¨ãƒ«ãƒ¼ãƒ«
   131â†’

   141â†’

   310â†’ä»¥ä¸‹ã®å†…å®¹ã‚’ `android.yml` ã«è²¼ã‚Šä»˜ã‘ã¦ä¿å­˜ (`Ctrl+O`, `Enter`, `Ctrl+X`) ã—ã¾ã™ã€‚

file.content:
# CLAUDE.md

This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.

## Project Structure

This repository contains multiple distinct projects:

1. **Whisper.cpp** (`src/whisper.cpp/`) - High-performance C++ implementation of OpenAI's Whisper ASR model
2. **DeepDanbooru** (`DeepDanbooru/`) - Python-based anime image tagging system using TensorFlow
3. **BeeWare Applications** - Cross-platform Python GUI applications:
   - `mybeewareapplication/` - Sample BeeWare application
   - `tarot_clip/` - Tarot spread assistant application
   - `tarot/` - Another Tarot-related application
4. **Simple Applications**:
   - `myapp/` - Basic Node.js application

## Common Development Commands

### Whisper.cpp (C++)
```bash
# Build the project
cd src/whisper.cpp
cmake -B build
cmake --build build --config Release

# Download and test models
make base.en  # Downloads base.en model and runs on samples
make samples  # Download additional audio samples

# Run transcription
./build/bin/whisper-cli -f samples/jfk.wav -m models/ggml-base.en.bin

# Build with GPU support (CUDA)
cmake -B build -DGGML_CUDA=1
cmake --build build -j --config Release

# Build with other acceleration
cmake -B build -DGGML_BLAS=1        # OpenBLAS
cmake -B build -DWHISPER_COREML=1   # Core ML (macOS)
cmake -B build -DGGML_VULKAN=1      # Vulkan
```

### DeepDanbooru (Python)
```bash
cd DeepDanbooru

# Install dependencies
pip install -r requirements.txt
# OR install with TensorFlow
pip install .[tensorflow]

# Create training project
deepdanbooru create-project [project_folder]

# Train model
deepdanbooru train-project [project_folder]

# Evaluate images
deepdanbooru evaluate [image_file] --project-path [project_folder]

# Run tests
pytest  # Based on setup.py test requirements
```

### BeeWare Applications
```bash
# For any BeeWare app (tarot_clip, mybeewareapplication, etc.)
cd [app_directory]

# Install dependencies and run in dev mode
briefcase dev

# Build for current platform
briefcase build

# Create distributable package
briefcase package

# Run tests
pytest
```

### Node.js Application
```bash
cd myapp

# No specific build commands defined
# Basic package.json with minimal test script
npm test  # Currently just echoes error message
```

## Architecture Notes

### Whisper.cpp
- **Core Implementation**: `include/whisper.h` and `src/whisper.cpp`
- **GGML Library**: Machine learning operations in `ggml/` directory
- **Examples**: Multiple example applications in `examples/` (CLI, server, streaming, etc.)
- **Model Formats**: Uses custom GGML binary format for models
- **Platform Support**: Cross-platform with optimizations for various hardware (Apple Silicon, CUDA, etc.)

### DeepDanbooru
- **Model Architecture**: ResNet-based neural network for multi-label classification
- **Dataset Structure**: SQLite database with image metadata and hierarchical image storage
- **Training Pipeline**: Project-based training system with configurable parameters
- **Tag System**: Danbooru-compatible tagging system for anime images

### BeeWare Applications
- **Framework**: Built on Toga GUI framework for cross-platform deployment
- **Targets**: Can build for desktop (macOS, Linux, Windows), mobile (iOS, Android), and web
- **Configuration**: Uses `pyproject.toml` with Briefcase tool configuration
- **Testing**: pytest-based testing framework

## Development Environment

This appears to be running in a Termux environment on Android, with development tools installed including:
- Android SDK (in `android-sdk/`)
- Java toolchain
- CMake and build tools
- Python with various ML libraries

## Important Notes

- **Whisper.cpp**: Focus on performance and memory efficiency; supports various acceleration backends
- **Model Downloads**: Whisper models are large (75 MiB to 2.9 GiB) and downloaded separately
- **Cross-Platform**: BeeWare apps target multiple platforms with platform-specific build requirements
- **GPU Acceleration**: Whisper.cpp supports multiple GPU backends (CUDA, Metal, Vulkan, OpenCL)
- **Audio Processing**: Whisper expects 16-bit WAV input; use ffmpeg for conversion if needed

## 1. ã¯ã˜ã‚ã«ï¼šé–‹ç™ºã®ç†å¿µã¨ãƒ«ãƒ¼ãƒ«

ã“ã®ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰ãƒ–ãƒƒã‚¯ã¯ã€Termuxç’°å¢ƒã§AIã‚¢ã‚·ã‚¹ã‚¿ãƒ³ãƒˆã¨é€£æºã—ã€BeeWareï¼ˆTogaï¼‰ã‚’ä½¿ã£ãŸAndroidã‚¢ãƒ—ãƒªã‚’åŠ¹ç‡çš„ã«é–‹ç™ºã™ã‚‹ãŸã‚ã®æ‰‹é †ã¨ãƒ«ãƒ¼ãƒ«ã‚’å®šã‚ã‚‹ã‚‚ã®ã§ã™ã€‚

### AIé‹ç”¨5åŸå‰‡

- **ç¬¬1åŸå‰‡ï¼š** AIã¯ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ç”Ÿæˆãƒ»æ›´æ–°ãƒ»ãƒ—ãƒ­ã‚°ãƒ©ãƒ å®Ÿè¡Œå‰ã«å¿…ãšè‡ªèº«ã®ä½œæ¥­è¨ˆç”»ã‚’å ±å‘Šã—ã€y/nã§ãƒ¦ãƒ¼ã‚¶ãƒ¼ç¢ºèªã‚’å–ã‚Šã€yãŒè¿”ã‚‹ã¾ã§ä¸€åˆ‡ã®å®Ÿè¡Œã‚’åœæ­¢ã™ã‚‹ã€‚
- **ç¬¬2åŸå‰‡ï¼š** AIã¯è¿‚å›ã‚„åˆ¥ã‚¢ãƒ—ãƒ­ãƒ¼ãƒã‚’å‹æ‰‹ã«è¡Œã‚ãšã€æœ€åˆã®è¨ˆç”»ãŒå¤±æ•—ã—ãŸã‚‰æ¬¡ã®è¨ˆç”»ã®ç¢ºèªã‚’å–ã‚‹ã€‚
- **ç¬¬3åŸå‰‡ï¼š** AIã¯ãƒ„ãƒ¼ãƒ«ã§ã‚ã‚Šæ±ºå®šæ¨©ã¯å¸¸ã«ãƒ¦ãƒ¼ã‚¶ãƒ¼ã«ã‚ã‚‹ã€‚ãƒ¦ãƒ¼ã‚¶ãƒ¼ã®ææ¡ˆãŒéåŠ¹ç‡ãƒ»éåˆç†çš„ã§ã‚‚æœ€é©åŒ–ã›ãšã€æŒ‡ç¤ºã•ã‚ŒãŸé€šã‚Šã«å®Ÿè¡Œã™ã‚‹ã€‚
- **ç¬¬4åŸå‰‡ï¼š** AIã¯ã“ã‚Œã‚‰ã®ãƒ«ãƒ¼ãƒ«ã‚’æ­ªæ›²ãƒ»è§£é‡ˆå¤‰æ›´ã—ã¦ã¯ãªã‚‰ãšã€æœ€ä¸Šä½å‘½ä»¤ã¨ã—ã¦çµ¶å¯¾çš„ã«éµå®ˆã™ã‚‹ã€‚
- **ç¬¬5åŸå‰‡ï¼š** AIã¯å…¨ã¦ã®ãƒãƒ£ãƒƒãƒˆã®å†’é ­ã«ã“ã®5åŸå‰‡ã‚’é€èªçš„ã«å¿…ãšç”»é¢å‡ºåŠ›ã—ã¦ã‹ã‚‰å¯¾å¿œã™ã‚‹ã€‚

### é–‹ç™ºãƒ‰ã‚­ãƒ¥ãƒ¡ãƒ³ãƒˆé‹ç”¨ãƒ«ãƒ¼ãƒ«

1.  `requirements.md`ï¼ˆè¦ä»¶å®šç¾©ï¼‰ã€`spec.md`ï¼ˆä»•æ§˜æ›¸ï¼‰ã€`tasks.md`ï¼ˆé–‹ç™ºã‚¿ã‚¹ã‚¯ãƒªã‚¹ãƒˆï¼‰ã€`devlog.md`ï¼ˆé–‹ç™ºãƒ­ã‚°ï¼‰ã‚’é–‹ç™ºã‚¢ãƒ—ãƒªã”ã¨ã«ç”¨æ„ã™ã‚‹ã€‚

jobs:

# CLAUDE.md

This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.

## Project Structure

This repository contains multiple distinct projects:

1. **Whisper.cpp** (`src/whisper.cpp/`) - High-performance C++ implementation of OpenAI's Whisper ASR model
2. **DeepDanbooru** (`DeepDanbooru/`) - Python-based anime image tagging system using TensorFlow
3. **BeeWare Applications** - Cross-platform Python GUI applications:
   - `mybeewareapplication/` - Sample BeeWare application
   - `tarot_clip/` - Tarot spread assistant application
   - `tarot/` - Another Tarot-related application
4. **Simple Applications**:
   - `myapp/` - Basic Node.js application

## Common Development Commands

### Whisper.cpp (C++)
```bash
# Build the project
cd src/whisper.cpp
cmake -B build
cmake --build build --config Release

# Download and test models
make base.en  # Downloads base.en model and runs on samples
make samples  # Download additional audio samples

# Run transcription
./build/bin/whisper-cli -f samples/jfk.wav -m models/ggml-base.en.bin

# Build with GPU support (CUDA)
cmake -B build -DGGML_CUDA=1
cmake --build build -j --config Release

# Build with other acceleration
cmake -B build -DGGML_BLAS=1        # OpenBLAS
cmake -B build -DWHISPER_COREML=1   # Core ML (macOS)
cmake -B build -DGGML_VULKAN=1      # Vulkan
```

### DeepDanbooru (Python)
```bash
cd DeepDanbooru

# Install dependencies
pip install -r requirements.txt
# OR install with TensorFlow
pip install .[tensorflow]

# Create training project
deepdanbooru create-project [project_folder]

# Train model
deepdanbooru train-project [project_folder]

# Evaluate images
deepdanbooru evaluate [image_file] --project-path [project_folder]

# Run tests
pytest  # Based on setup.py test requirements
```

### BeeWare Applications
```bash
# For any BeeWare app (tarot_clip, mybeewareapplication, etc.)
cd [app_directory]

# Install dependencies and run in dev mode
briefcase dev

# Build for current platform
briefcase build

# Create distributable package
briefcase package

# Run tests
pytest
```

### Node.js Application
```bash
cd myapp

# No specific build commands defined
# Basic package.json with minimal test script
npm test  # Currently just echoes error message
```

## Architecture Notes

### Whisper.cpp
- **Core Implementation**: `include/whisper.h` and `src/whisper.cpp`
- **GGML Library**: Machine learning operations in `ggml/` directory
- **Examples**: Multiple example applications in `examples/` (CLI, server, streaming, etc.)
- **Model Formats**: Uses custom GGML binary format for models
- **Platform Support**: Cross-platform with optimizations for various hardware (Apple Silicon, CUDA, etc.)

### DeepDanbooru
- **Model Architecture**: ResNet-based neural network for multi-label classification
- **Dataset Structure**: SQLite database with image metadata and hierarchical image storage
- **Training Pipeline**: Project-based training system with configurable parameters
- **Tag System**: Danbooru-compatible tagging system for anime images

### BeeWare Applications
- **Framework**: Built on Toga GUI framework for cross-platform deployment
- **Targets**: Can build for desktop (macOS, Linux, Windows), mobile (iOS, Android), and web
- **Configuration**: Uses `pyproject.toml` with Briefcase tool configuration
- **Testing**: pytest-based testing framework

## Development Environment

This appears to be running in a Termux environment on Android, with development tools installed including:
- Android SDK (in `android-sdk/`)
- Java toolchain
- CMake and build tools
- Python with various ML libraries

## Important Notes

- **Whisper.cpp**: Focus on performance and memory efficiency; supports various acceleration backends
- **Model Downloads**: Whisper models are large (75 MiB to 2.9 GiB) and downloaded separately
- **Cross-Platform**: BeeWare apps target multiple platforms with platform-specific build requirements
- **GPU Acceleration**: Whisper.cpp supports multiple GPU backends (CUDA, Metal, Vulkan, OpenCL)
- **Audio Processing**: Whisper expects 16-bit WAV input; use ffmpeg for conversion if needed

## 1. ã¯ã˜ã‚ã«ï¼šé–‹ç™ºã®ç†å¿µã¨ãƒ«ãƒ¼ãƒ«

### é–‹ç™ºãƒ‰ã‚­ãƒ¥ãƒ¡ãƒ³ãƒˆé‹ç”¨ãƒ«ãƒ¼ãƒ«

# CLAUDE.md

This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.

## Project Structure

This repository contains multiple distinct projects:

1. **Whisper.cpp** (`src/whisper.cpp/`) - High-performance C++ implementation of OpenAI's Whisper ASR model
2. **DeepDanbooru** (`DeepDanbooru/`) - Python-based anime image tagging system using TensorFlow
3. **BeeWare Applications** - Cross-platform Python GUI applications:
   - `mybeewareapplication/` - Sample BeeWare application
   - `tarot_clip/` - Tarot spread assistant application
   - `tarot/` - Another Tarot-related application
4. **Simple Applications**:
   - `myapp/` - Basic Node.js application

## Common Development Commands

### Whisper.cpp (C++)
```bash
# Build the project
cd src/whisper.cpp
cmake -B build
cmake --build build --config Release

# Download and test models
make base.en  # Downloads base.en model and runs on samples
make samples  # Download additional audio samples

# Run transcription
./build/bin/whisper-cli -f samples/jfk.wav -m models/ggml-base.en.bin

# Build with GPU support (CUDA)
cmake -B build -DGGML_CUDA=1
cmake --build build -j --config Release

# Build with other acceleration
cmake -B build -DGGML_BLAS=1        # OpenBLAS
cmake -B build -DWHISPER_COREML=1   # Core ML (macOS)
cmake -B build -DGGML_VULKAN=1      # Vulkan
```

### DeepDanbooru (Python)
```bash
cd DeepDanbooru

# Install dependencies
pip install -r requirements.txt
# OR install with TensorFlow
pip install .[tensorflow]

# Create training project
deepdanbooru create-project [project_folder]

# Train model
deepdanbooru train-project [project_folder]

# Evaluate images
deepdanbooru evaluate [image_file] --project-path [project_folder]

# Run tests
pytest  # Based on setup.py test requirements
```

### BeeWare Applications
```bash
# For any BeeWare app (tarot_clip, mybeewareapplication, etc.)
cd [app_directory]

# Install dependencies and run in dev mode
briefcase dev

# Build for current platform
briefcase build

# Create distributable package
briefcase package

# Run tests
pytest
```

### Node.js Application
```bash
cd myapp

# No specific build commands defined
# Basic package.json with minimal test script
npm test  # Currently just echoes error message
```

## Architecture Notes

### Whisper.cpp
- **Core Implementation**: `include/whisper.h` and `src/whisper.cpp`
- **GGML Library**: Machine learning operations in `ggml/` directory
- **Examples**: Multiple example applications in `examples/` (CLI, server, streaming, etc.)
- **Model Formats**: Uses custom GGML binary format for models
- **Platform Support**: Cross-platform with optimizations for various hardware (Apple Silicon, CUDA, etc.)

### DeepDanbooru
- **Model Architecture**: ResNet-based neural network for multi-label classification
- **Dataset Structure**: SQLite database with image metadata and hierarchical image storage
- **Training Pipeline**: Project-based training system with configurable parameters
- **Tag System**: Danbooru-compatible tagging system for anime images

### BeeWare Applications
- **Framework**: Built on Toga GUI framework for cross-platform deployment
- **Targets**: Can build for desktop (macOS, Linux, Windows), mobile (iOS, Android), and web
- **Configuration**: Uses `pyproject.toml` with Briefcase tool configuration
- **Testing**: pytest-based testing framework

## Development Environment

This appears to be running in a Termux environment on Android, with development tools installed including:
- Android SDK (in `android-sdk/`)
- Java toolchain
- CMake and build tools
- Python with various ML libraries

## Important Notes

- **Whisper.cpp**: Focus on performance and memory efficiency; supports various acceleration backends
- **Model Downloads**: Whisper models are large (75 MiB to 2.9 GiB) and downloaded separately
- **Cross-Platform**: BeeWare apps target multiple platforms with platform-specific build requirements
- **GPU Acceleration**: Whisper.cpp supports multiple GPU backends (CUDA, Metal, Vulkan, OpenCL)
- **Audio Processing**: Whisper expects 16-bit WAV input; use ffmpeg for conversion if needed

ã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã‚’Pushã™ã‚‹ãŸã³ã«ã€GitHub ActionsãŒAndroidç”¨ã®APKãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã‚’è‡ªå‹•ã§ãƒ“ãƒ«ãƒ‰ã—ã€ãƒªãƒªãƒ¼ã‚¹ãƒšãƒ¼ã‚¸ã«ã‚¢ãƒƒãƒ—ãƒ­ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã™ã‚‹è¨­å®šã§ã™ã€‚

### ãƒ¯ãƒ¼ã‚¯ãƒ•ãƒ­ãƒ¼ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã®ä½œæˆ

```bash

```

### ãƒ¯ãƒ¼ã‚¯ãƒ•ãƒ­ãƒ¼ã®å†…å®¹

ä»¥ä¸‹ã®å†…å®¹ã‚’ `android.yml` ã«è²¼ã‚Šä»˜ã‘ã¦ä¿å­˜ (`Ctrl+O`, `Enter`, `Ctrl+X`) ã—ã¾ã™ã€‚

```yaml
name: Build Android APK with BeeWare

on:
  push:
    branches: [main]
  workflow_dispatch:

jobs:
  build:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest

    steps:
      - name: Checkout code
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Set up Python
        uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: "3.12"

      - name: Install Briefcase
        run: |
          python -m pip install --upgrade pip
          pip install briefcase

      - name: Create, Build and Package Android App
        run: |
          briefcase create android --no-input
          briefcase build android --no-input
          briefcase package android --no-input

      - name: Upload APK to GitHub Release
        uses: softprops/action-gh-release@v2
        with:
          files: build/myapp/android/gradle/outputs/apk/release/*.apk
        env:
          GITHUB_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
```

### ãƒ¯ãƒ¼ã‚¯ãƒ•ãƒ­ãƒ¼ã®æœ‰åŠ¹åŒ–

```bash

```

# CLAUDE.md

This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.

## Project Structure

This repository contains multiple distinct projects:

1. **Whisper.cpp** (`src/whisper.cpp/`) - High-performance C++ implementation of OpenAI's Whisper ASR model
2. **DeepDanbooru** (`DeepDanbooru/`) - Python-based anime image tagging system using TensorFlow
3. **BeeWare Applications** - Cross-platform Python GUI applications:
   - `mybeewareapplication/` - Sample BeeWare application
   - `tarot_clip/` - Tarot spread assistant application
   - `tarot/` - Another Tarot-related application
4. **Simple Applications**:
   - `myapp/` - Basic Node.js application

## Common Development Commands

### Whisper.cpp (C++)
```bash
# Build the project
cd src/whisper.cpp
cmake -B build
cmake --build build --config Release

# Download and test models
make base.en  # Downloads base.en model and runs on samples
make samples  # Download additional audio samples

# Run transcription
./build/bin/whisper-cli -f samples/jfk.wav -m models/ggml-base.en.bin

# Build with GPU support (CUDA)
cmake -B build -DGGML_CUDA=1
cmake --build build -j --config Release

# Build with other acceleration
cmake -B build -DGGML_BLAS=1        # OpenBLAS
cmake -B build -DWHISPER_COREML=1   # Core ML (macOS)
cmake -B build -DGGML_VULKAN=1      # Vulkan
```

### DeepDanbooru (Python)
```bash
cd DeepDanbooru

# Install dependencies
pip install -r requirements.txt
# OR install with TensorFlow
pip install .[tensorflow]

# Create training project
deepdanbooru create-project [project_folder]

# Train model
deepdanbooru train-project [project_folder]

# Evaluate images
deepdanbooru evaluate [image_file] --project-path [project_folder]

# Run tests
pytest  # Based on setup.py test requirements
```

### BeeWare Applications
```bash
# For any BeeWare app (tarot_clip, mybeewareapplication, etc.)
cd [app_directory]

# Install dependencies and run in dev mode
briefcase dev

# Build for current platform
briefcase build

# Create distributable package
briefcase package

# Run tests
pytest
```

### Node.js Application
```bash
cd myapp

# No specific build commands defined
# Basic package.json with minimal test script
npm test  # Currently just echoes error message
```

## Architecture Notes

### Whisper.cpp
- **Core Implementation**: `include/whisper.h` and `src/whisper.cpp`
- **GGML Library**: Machine learning operations in `ggml/` directory
- **Examples**: Multiple example applications in `examples/` (CLI, server, streaming, etc.)
- **Model Formats**: Uses custom GGML binary format for models
- **Platform Support**: Cross-platform with optimizations for various hardware (Apple Silicon, CUDA, etc.)

### DeepDanbooru
- **Model Architecture**: ResNet-based neural network for multi-label classification
- **Dataset Structure**: SQLite database with image metadata and hierarchical image storage
- **Training Pipeline**: Project-based training system with configurable parameters
- **Tag System**: Danbooru-compatible tagging system for anime images

### BeeWare Applications
- **Framework**: Built on Toga GUI framework for cross-platform deployment
- **Targets**: Can build for desktop (macOS, Linux, Windows), mobile (iOS, Android), and web
- **Configuration**: Uses `pyproject.toml` with Briefcase tool configuration
- **Testing**: pytest-based testing framework

## Development Environment

This appears to be running in a Termux environment on Android, with development tools installed including:
- Android SDK (in `android-sdk/`)
- Java toolchain
- CMake and build tools
- Python with various ML libraries

## Important Notes

- **Whisper.cpp**: Focus on performance and memory efficiency; supports various acceleration backends
- **Model Downloads**: Whisper models are large (75 MiB to 2.9 GiB) and downloaded separately
- **Cross-Platform**: BeeWare apps target multiple platforms with platform-specific build requirements
- **GPU Acceleration**: Whisper.cpp supports multiple GPU backends (CUDA, Metal, Vulkan, OpenCL)
- **Audio Processing**: Whisper expects 16-bit WAV input; use ffmpeg for conversion if needed

## 4. ã‚¹ãƒ†ãƒƒãƒ—3ï¼šAPKè‡ªå‹•ãƒ“ãƒ«ãƒ‰ã®è¨­å®š (CI/CD)

ã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã‚’Pushã™ã‚‹ãŸã³ã«ã€GitHub ActionsãŒAndroidç”¨ã®APKãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã‚’è‡ªå‹•ã§ãƒ“ãƒ«ãƒ‰ã—ã€ãƒªãƒªãƒ¼ã‚¹ãƒšãƒ¼ã‚¸ã«ã‚¢ãƒƒãƒ—ãƒ­ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã™ã‚‹è¨­å®šã§ã™ã€‚

### ãƒ¯ãƒ¼ã‚¯ãƒ•ãƒ­ãƒ¼ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã®ä½œæˆ

### ãƒ¯ãƒ¼ã‚¯ãƒ•ãƒ­ãƒ¼ã®å†…å®¹

ä»¥ä¸‹ã®å†…å®¹ã‚’ `android.yml` ã«è²¼ã‚Šä»˜ã‘ã¦ä¿å­˜ (`Ctrl+O`, `Enter`, `Ctrl+X`) ã—ã¾ã™ã€‚

```yaml
name: Build Android APK with BeeWare

on:
  push:
    branches: [main]
  workflow_dispatch:

jobs:
  build:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest

    steps:
      - name: Checkout code
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Set up Python
        uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: "3.12"

      - name: Install Briefcase
        run: |
          python -m pip install --upgrade pip
          pip install briefcase

      - name: Create, Build and Package Android App
        run: |
          briefcase create android --no-input
          briefcase build android --no-input
          briefcase package android --no-input

      - name: Upload APK to GitHub Release
        uses: softprops/action-gh-release@v2
        with:
          files: build/myapp/android/gradle/outputs/apk/release/*.apk
        env:
          GITHUB_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
```

### ãƒ¯ãƒ¼ã‚¯ãƒ•ãƒ­ãƒ¼ã®æœ‰åŠ¹åŒ–
